message: Hello Person1. Yep, just got a call for MM/DD/YYYY w Dr. B on MM/DD/YYYY. Re Oxy 15mg rapid release: per Dr. Person2's desire and Dr. B agree to get Person3 off Oxy ext release ASAP, and work down to lowest usage Oxy rapid w/o dealing w break through pain, which can be pretty nasty. I've set up Person3's other am, MM/DD/YYYY, pm meds w 7.5mg Oxy 3x diem, with 7.5 Oxy boosters once, twice a day as needed. Trying to keep Oxy steady at MM/DD/YYYY, but MM/DD/YYYY had to go MM/DD/YYYY. 30 count has gotten him through MM/DD/YYYY, considering ste p down and a few tough pain MM/DD/YYYY thereafter. Re Eliquis: MM/DD/YYYY two 5mg tabs morning and night; MM/DD/YYYY one 5mg am and one 5mg pm. Sig swelling (but improving slightly) swelling of right leg persists. Person3 is tolerating all meds well and following directions. Appetite, a bit of a struggle, as expected; digestion normal (that may become diarrhea as radiation has started MM/DD/YYYY). Dr. B recommends Metamucil 1 tsp 2x diem. Other symptoms: quite tired, napping, MM/DD/YYYY recently interrupted by anxiety attacks. Thanks a ton, Person1, best – Person4

I was happy to see that this was trending down. We do not have  a comparison for the CEA, but if this serves us value in the future, we will then have something to look back and compare to. Take care, RDL   ----- Message ----- From:  Sent:  To: Subject: RE: Visit Follow-Up Question  Hi Dr Person2, At our last appointment we discussed getting the cancer antigen test at my next blood work. I thought we were doing the CA 27 Dash 29 that I have always had done but no results have come in for that. A test result for CEA came in but I don't know what that is. I have nothing to compare that to although it appears the numbers pretty high which is concerning. I was wondering if there was a reason for switching to a different test? The 27/29 has been a good indicator for me in the past. Thank you

message: Hi Person1, Patients on PI3 kinase inhibitors like Person2 can get a type of pneumonia called PCP pneumonia. Bactrim is an antibiotic given to prevent this. It is taken as one tablet on MM/DD/YYYY, MM/DD/YYYY, and MM/DD/YYYY. Please pick it up and start it. Let me know if you have any issues with it like rashes or diarrhea . Most people tolerate it fine 3 times per week. I realized you were not on it when I finalized my last note, and I thought I messaged you, but it sounds like I didn't. I apologize for the confusion.

message: Hello Person1,    Received a call yesterday concerning the pathology results for a nodule they removed on my vocal chords. It seems they are concerned it could be cancer. Appreciate if you would take a look at the results and let me have your opinion. I interpreting it as early stage throat cancer and presume we are looking at more surgery. They ordered a CT scan of the neck for MM/DD/YYYY and a ENT consultation on MM/DD/YYYY. Am assuming this is my new normal now and that we going to continue to find more of this as time goes by. Seems my immune system is not doing its job at stopping this stuff from occurring? Best regards,  Person2

message: Hi Person1, There is always the potential for further nerve recovery, but its also something that we cannot count on at this point. This problem is not a usual risk with this surgery, but in your case the tumor extended behind some of the blood vessels in the neck and was pushing on this nerve. Removing the tumor re quiring pushing on the nerve some to get the tumor out. I will put in a referral for you to see an occuloplastic surgeon.

message: I need to postpone the appointments made for MM/DD/YYYY, and MM/DD/YYYY for the initial doses of Fulvestrant, that we discussed in your office. I have not completely recovered from the surgery of MM/DD/YYYY. I still have the surgical drain in place, and have a potential appointment tomorrow, MM/DD/YYYY to see Dr  Person2, but it is dependent on fluid accumulation, which I am afraid will not be low enough by then, for removal. Given my history of ulcerative colitis, I am concerned about diarrhea, and I am Very concerned about the Verzenio pill regarding diarrhea. We also could not recall the length of time these therapies would last, nor the potential additional benefit from the addition of the Verzenio. If I encounter an adverse reaction, we were wondering how long it would take to get back to normal after stopping the Fulvestrant and Verzenio. Finally, we were wondering about the additional benefits of these two medications, as compared to Tamoxifen alone which I have tolerated well in the past.
